alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 11:51AM MDT until June 18 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. For the Green River Basin...including Big Piney, La Barge...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Bear River...including Pixley Dam, Cokeville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Bear River below Pixley Dam. * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Bankfull stage. At 8.5 feet, Flood stage. Minor agricultural flooding especially along left bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near 8 feet tonight before slowly falling to around 7.5 feet this weekend. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, which may be eroded by the fast-moving water. Please report observed flooding to local law enforcement or emergency management.
